chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominique D Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentences being served.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentences being served.

records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order dismissing

records.addlTxt: A copy of the Notice of Appeal that was filed with the circuit court on November 12, 2019 and the circuit court case record have been received and docketed on this date.
All transcripts necessary are on file
Copy of Letter to COA re: SPD Response re: appointment

IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and this appeal is dismissed without prejudice.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this matter is referred to the Office of the State Public Defender to consider appointment of new counsel for Bryant, any such appointment to be made within forty-five days after this order.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the State Public Defenders Office shall notify this court within five days after either a new lawyer is appointed for Bryant or the State Public Defender determines that new counsel will not be appointed.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Bryant to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended until forty-five days after the date on which this court receives notice from the public defenders office advising either that it has appointed new counsel for Bryant or that new counsel will not be appointed.

records.addlTxt: for Dominique Bryant from Columbia Correctional Institution for Sentencing Hearing on Tuesday, November 28, 2017 at 9:30 AM - emailed RCSO at 1:48 p.m.
Updated restitution documents
BOND REVOKED PENDING SENTENCING.
Sentencing hearing on November 28, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Dominique D Bryant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dominique D Bryant in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State intends to call rebuttal witnesses. Parties review proposed JI. The State recalls DA - remains under oath. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State recalls Inv. Steve Diener - remains under oath. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. State rests their case in rebuttal. The Court instructs the jury. Closing arguments by the State. Closing arguments by the Defense. Rebuttal by the State. Final JI given by the Court. Names tumbled, alternate chosen. Oath #4 given. Jury begins deliberation at 11:40 am. Defense moves to dismiss. The State asks the Court to deny the motion with the same argument as previously stated. BTC: motion to dismiss is denied. The jury will decide.
The State does not object Ex #1 & 5 going back to the jury. The State doesn't object to the jury hearing Ex #6. The rest of the exhibits, the State objects to them going back to the jury. BTC: If the jury asks for Ex #1- the Court will send it back. If they ask for Ex #5-parties will be called. No other exhibits may be sent back.

P.M. - Deputy Court Clerk: AB.
Defendant Dominique D. Bryant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dominique D. Bryant in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers and Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.
Jury has 2 questions.  1.) Jury requesting to hear audio recording.  State wishes to replay audio.  Defense objects.  BTC: Jury will hear recording.  2.) Requesting photo lineup exhibit.  Both State and Defense object.  BTC: Jury will not review photo lineup.  Jury enters courtroom. Audio played to jury.  Jury again retires at 1:13 p.m. to continue deliberations.

Jury returns with verdict at: 2:22 p.m.
COUNT 1: GUILTY of Amended Charge of Misdemeanor Theft.
Court polls the jury.
State renews objections of lesser charge.
State moves for Judgment on the Verdict.
Defense does not obj.
BTC: Judgment on the Verdict entered.
Defense requests bond to be revoked.
BTC: BOND REVOKED.
Sentence hearing on November 28, 2017 at 9:30 a.m. in Br. 4.
#6 DVD
for return/destruction of exhibits

Ex #1-Google map
       2-Photo of deft as chosen by victim
       3-Cell assignment history
       4-Securas Log
       5-Surveillance Photo
       6-DVD of jail call

Defendant Dominique D Bryant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dominique D Bryant in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties argue the matter of using the lineup and the statement that just came to light to the State early this morning. BTC: The Statement appears to be a spontaneous statement made to an unknown person via the telephone in the jail with the knowledge that all calls are recorded. The State may amend their witness list to include someone from the jail to lay a foundation as to the recording of the statement and may introduce said statement at trial.
The defendant has chosen to go forward with trial. The Defense requests they be allowed to amend their witness list as well. The State indicates that the witness that the defense proposes to add is represented by SPD and is also under a competency exam order. The proposed witness would be a clear conflict for the defense.  Defense now moves to withdraw citing his inability to adequately represent this deft. BTC: Motion to amend witness list by the defense is denied. Photo lineup may be used as evidence, however, they may not be referred to mugshots or prisoner photos. Motion to withdraw by the defense is denied. The defense request to admit previous contact with the victim is allowed. Jury enters 11:16 am; Oath #2 given. The Court gives preliminary instructions to the jury. Opening statements given by parties. The State calls Officer Patrick Hale- DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. Defense marks Ex #1/moved into evidence-Rec'd & publ. Sidebars put on the record. Parties review prior convictions of the deft and agree that should the deft be questioned, the answer should be 7. The State calls DA - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #2/moved into evidence-Rec'd. Cross xam by defense. State calls Lt. Bradley Friend - DSAT. Direct by the State. State marks Ex #3; moved into evidence/Rec'd; Ex #4; moved into evidence/Rec'd; Ex #5; moved into evidence/Rec'd; Ex #6-DVD of jail phone call; moved into evidence/rec'd & played. No cross. State calls Inv. Steve Diener - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by defense. The State has no further evidence and rests its case in chief. Defense moves for dismissal as they do not believe the State met its burden. State objects and indicates a reasonable jury could find the deft guilty. BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. Defense indicates that the defendant wishes to testify. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. BTC: The Court finds the defendant freely knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to remain silent. Defense calls DB - DSAT. Direct by the defense. Cross xam by the State. Defense calls Officer Patrick Hale-oath continues. Direct by defense. Cross xam by the State. Redirect by defense. No further witnesses. Defense rests.
AMENDED

Defendant Dominique D Bryant in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Dominique D Bryant in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties are prepared to go forward today. All witnesses are sequestered. The Court will seat 23, parties have 5 strikes each. Defense does not oppose the State's MIL The State puts the final offer on the record. Defense indicates the defendant rejects the offer and wishes to go to trial. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant. Jury enters, Oath #1 given. Voir dire by the Court. Parties introduce themselves, the others in their office and their witnesses. Voir dire by Ms. Sommers for the State. Voir dire by Mr. Hamad for the Defense. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. Jury is chosen. Parties agree on the jury as chosen
Defense
State
AMENDED

Attorney Helmi Hamad in court.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Deft is not present; deft is being housed at Columbia Correctional. The purpose of today's hearing is to ensure that the victim is cooperative and that he will be brought back for trial. The State indicates that the victim is cooperative and his plane tickets have been purchased.

BTC: Trial remains

Attorney Helmi Hamad in court.  Sean Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rebecca Sommers appears later in the heariang. Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense reports that the deft was transferred to the prison system. Deft is housed at Columbia Correctional Institution. No other issues noted by the State. Defense indicates that due to the speedy trial demand not being met, the Court modified bond to a signature bond. Defense now asks for cash bond. Defense asks for STC prior to jury trial date to ensure that the 'main' witness has been subpoena'd and will appear for trial.

BTC: The Court cannot consider bond w/o the defendant being present.  Additionally, the deft made a decision previously to ask for a signature bond which the Court granted. Non evidentiary pretrial to be set  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 09:00 am.
